messages.content: What is the purpose of the SigmaWaveFormNode?
The SigmaWaveFormNode generates a variety of waveforms with adjustable parameters such as amplitude, frequency, damping factor, and waveform type.
Which waveform types does the SigmaWaveFormNode support?
The SigmaWaveFormNode supports sine, sawtooth, stepped, square, random, triangle, and rectangular waveforms.
What does the SigmaWaveFormNode provide for optional Fourier transformation and uni-directional output?
The SigmaWaveFormNode provides optional Fourier transformation and uni-directional output.
What are the parameters of the SigmaWaveFormNode?
The SigmaWaveFormNode has parameters such as steps, amplitude, frequency, damping_factor, waveform_type, enable_damping, min_sigma, apply_fourier, horizontal_length, and enable_unidirectional.
What is the purpose of the SigmaWaveFormNodeAdvanced?
The SigmaWaveFormNodeAdvanced extends the functionality of the standard waveform generator by supporting the blending of two different waveforms.
What are the additional parameters in SigmaWaveFormNodeAdvanced?

The SigmaWaveFormNodeAdvanced has additional parameters such as amplitude1, frequency1, waveform_type1, amplitude2, frequency2, waveform_type2, blend_factor, damping_factor, enable_damping, min_sigma, apply_fourier, horizontal_length, and enable_unidirectional.
What does the FourierFilterNode do?
The FourierFilterNode processes an input sigma sequence using a Fourier transform, applies a frequency filter, and optionally performs an inverse Fourier transform.
What are the parameters of the FourierFilterNode?
The FourierFilterNode has parameters such as sigmas, filter_type, cutoff_frequency, and apply_inverse_fourier.
What does the AttenuatorNode do?
The AttenuatorNode adjusts the amplitude of a sigma sequence by applying an attenuation factor.
What are the parameters of the AttenuatorNode?
The AttenuatorNode has parameters such as sigmas and attenuation_factor.
What does the PhaseLockedLoopNode do?
The PhaseLockedLoopNode locks the phase of an input sigma sequence to a reference sigma sequence.
What are the parameters of the PhaseLockedLoopNode?
The PhaseLockedLoopNode has parameters such as input_sigmas, reference_sigmas, lock_factor, and frequency_range.
